messages.subject: Tamato no kami Tadayuki
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Group I have been looking at the Shinto Taikan p495 at the smith Tadayuki. The blade is signed omote Yamato Kami Shin (Nelson 2080) go hei (N201) Ei
messages.messageBody:
Dear Group

I have been looking at the Shinto Taikan p495 at the smith Tadayuki.

The blade is signed
omote
Yamato Kami Shin (Nelson 2080) go hei (N201) Ei (N1639) ? Fujiwara Tadayuki

ura

Baku (N2157) kitau (N4895) tsukuru kore Teikyo ni nen hachi gatsu kichi hi

To questions
1. What is being said between Kami and fujiwara? Not sure if I have
every seen this before.

2. What type of forging is being talked about on the ura side. i.e. what
is Baku kitau??

So maybe three questions.

3. Is there a list of the different forging techniques used by smiths?

thanks

david
(15 new swords and images listed on my web site)


--
David McDonald Collector of Japanese Swords and Old Iron
PO Box 265 WEB page - http://www.montanairon.com
